verses.plain: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

tokens.t: To every
a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

verses.plain: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

tokens.t: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up
planted;

verses.plain: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

tokens.t: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

verses.plain: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

tokens.t: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

verses.plain: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

tokens.t: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

verses.plain: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;

tokens.t: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;

verses.plain: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

tokens.t: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

verses.plain: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

tokens.t: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

verses.plain: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

tokens.t: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

verses.plain: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

tokens.t: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

verses.plain: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

tokens.t: He hath made every
beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

verses.plain: I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

tokens.t: I know that
no good in them, but for
to rejoice, and to do good in his life.

verses.plain: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

tokens.t: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it
the gift of God.

verses.plain: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.

tokens.t: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth
, that
should fear before him.

verses.plain: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

tokens.t: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

verses.plain: ¶ And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.

tokens.t: ¶ And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment,
wickedness
there; and the place of righteousness,
iniquity
there.

verses.plain: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

tokens.t: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for
a time there for every purpose and for every work.

verses.plain: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.

tokens.t: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.

verses.plain: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

tokens.t: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all
vanity.

verses.plain: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

tokens.t: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

verses.plain: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?

tokens.t: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?

verses.plain: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

tokens.t: Wherefore I perceive that
nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that
his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

footnotes.text: to refrain from: Heb. to be far from
that which is past: Heb. that which is driven away
that God…: or, that they might clear God, and see, etc
of man: Heb. of the sons of man
goeth upward: Heb. is ascending, etc
